meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of deism.
meanings.sent1: The deistic beliefs emphasize the importance of reason in understanding the divine.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the deistic approach to spirituality, focusing on natural laws rather than religious texts.
meanings.sent3: The deistic philosopher chuckled at the idea of a God who intervenes in human affairs.
meanings.sent4: His deistic view of the universe as a well-ordered clockwork mechanism was both comforting and awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The deistic principles guided her moral compass, rooted in rational contemplation of the world.

meanings.definition: Believing in the existence of a God on the evidence of reason and nature only, with rejection of supernatural revelation.
meanings.sent1: Their deistic faith led them to seek God through the study of the natural world.
meanings.sent2: The deistic perspective values individual reflection over blind faith in religious dogma.
meanings.sent3: In a deistic twist, he attributed the beautiful sunrise to the laws of physics rather than divine intervention.
meanings.sent4: The deistic thinker saw the interconnectedness of all life as evidence of a higher, rational design.
meanings.sent5: Her deistic worldview found solace in the harmony of the universe, devoid of mystical elements.
